summary: This document is an email chain from August 9-10, 2019, between attorney Bruce Barket and an unidentified official at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Barket requests updates on an investigation into an incident involving his client, Jeffrey Epstein, and later instructs that Epstein not be interviewed without his permission. The emails reference a lockdown at the MCC due to an incident 'all over the press'.

keyFacts: On August 9-10, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, Bruce Barket, was in communication with officials at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding an incident involving Epstein.
An official informed Barket that an investigation into the incident had concluded and no charges or disciplinary action would be filed against Epstein.
The MCC was under lockdown due to the incident, which was described as being 'all over the press' and referenced as a 'suicide attempt' in Barket's initial inquiry.
Attorney Bruce Barket explicitly instructed that Jeffrey Epstein was not to be interviewed about the incident without his (Barket's) permission.
The email chain shows active legal coordination and monitoring of Epstein's situation at the MCC just days before his death on August 10, 2019.
